intro: Coryphopteris simulata, commonly known as the slender tree fern, is a species of tree fern native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its tall, slender trunk and large, pinnate fronds that can reach several meters in length. The plant belongs to the family Cyatheaceae and is known for its ability to thrive in humid, shaded environments. Its rhizome system supports its growth, allowing it to form dense clumps over time. The fronds are typically evergreen, providing a lush, tropical appearance throughout the year.
